sub_title: Financial Officer at Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Inclusive Green Growth Department
summary:
After graduation from Schoevers ESA and working for an recruiting agency  in various admin-functions, I started working at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. First as a secretary, but gradually - after studying public administration in the evenings - I shifted to financial management and controlling.  Since 1996 I worked abroad at several Netherlands Embassies in 5 different African countries. In Mali I was responsible for consular and security matters, a challenging job in a low income country that suffered form a coup d'état. 

My skills in networking, analyzing and collaborating are well-appreciated.  I a perfectionist and not afraid to work hard. I find it import

I'm married, and mother of 3 teenagers. I feel privileged that I could help the Edgars Youth Program in Uganda (a local based soccer school with a vision for development) with their website and their soccer project for deaf children, and being inspired and collaborated with the National Lake Rescue Institute in Uganda. I enjoyed very much to get to know the Malian music ('desert blues') and their major musicians. It triggered me to participate at the Masterclass for Musical Entrepreneurs - with moderators coming from the top of the Dutch music industry.

profile_positions.company: Ministry of Foreign Affaires, Inclusive Green Growth Department
profile_positions.description: After being abroad since 1996, I moved back to the Netherlands in the summer of 2013. I currently working as administrative officer for the Controlling Unit of the Inclusive Green Growth Departmentt in the Netherlands. Climate change (how to mitigate and adapt to it), and especially support the poorer countries, is the core business of IGG. In order to improve our work processes together with my collegues by 'digitalizing' the paper work. We have created digital forms and set up a SharePoint (247) page to enable electronic collaboration and assessment of progress reports and payment requests.
profile_positions.title: Financial Officer

profile_positions.description: Back in West-Africa, but this time focussing on consular and security issues. Made sure, with the local and expat colleagues, that the consular tasks (passeport/visa applications, registration of Dutch people in Mali) were well accomplished. Coordination and collaboration with the Schengen partners (Netherlands was 2nd largest in number of visa applications after France). Assured the implementation of the new Visa Code, introduction of the biometric characteristics as part of application process and transition to the Regional Support Office. A new system for appointments was introduced succesfully. As the security situation was worsening in Mali, keeping the evacuation plans updated and testing them, became more important as well as monitoring the security security and keeping in touch with the Dutch community in Mali. The international schools closed for a few months, and many embassies send back their expat staff. I was also tasked with other operational management tasks like maintenance of the office and staff houses, human resource management and finances, in order to ensure a smooth running embassy under challenging situations where part of my job. My network in Mali consisted of members of the Dutch community, Malian authorities, Malian businesses and well-known musicians, US and Schengen embassies, Dutch NGO's a.o.
profile_positions.title: Attaché des Affaires Consulaires & Administratives, Ambassade du Royaume des Pays-Bas à Bamako, Mali

profile_positions.description: In charge of the operational management of a the Dutch Embassy in the Democratic Republic of Congo, that in 2008 almost doubled in number of staff. Security situation in Kinshasa was instable, so security issues where part of the day-to-day routine aimed at keeping our staff, the Dutch community and Embassy as safe and prepared as possible. First experience with consular affairs.
profile_positions.title: Head of Operational Management

profile_positions.description: As financial advisor In charge with the financial management of approx. 150 projects, varying from budget support to small scale activities. Uganda is also one of the partner countries - Netherlands development cooperation was mostly active in Education and the Justice, Law & Order Sector (JLOS), with a special focus on Northern Uganda. Assisted amongst others with the set-up of the financial management of a number of multi-donor basketfunds, and backstopping for a bursary scheme for former abductees and vulnerable adolescents (mostly victims of the LRA). In addition, I prepared the formation of the Emergency Response Team of the Embassy. Staff of the Dutch embassy as well as spouses where trained in the basics of first aid and fire fighting, I prepared and coordinated this pilot-training in collaboration with the Ministry's ERT coordinators and a Ugandan NGO National Lake Rescue. I was especially proud that this team of very mixed participants managed to succeed in the training and acted adequately in a real-life exercise, and we served as a best practice for other embassies.
profile_positions.title: Senior Financial Officer for Development Cooperation

profile_positions.description: Together with with the day-to-day operational management of the Netherlands Embassy in Paramaribo, especially human resource management, protocol affairs, finances and administration. The Embassy in Paramaribo was one out of 3 pilot-locations to test the new Oracle based administrative system and project database (Piramide) that was introduced at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in 2002. During the pilot, I was responsible for preparing the new administrative organisation, and developed routing forms to guide other users of Piramide. As a key-user I supported my colleagues in the use of this new financial administration. Another important part of my job was to organize and accompany visits of variousl Dutch  Ministers, mayors and other official missions. I coordinated the preparations and logitics of the annual Queens day reception - one of the major events in Surinam.
profile_positions.title: Dept. Head Operational Management

profile_positions.description:
My first posting abroad. First year that Netherlands Embassies where fully responsible for the allocated budgets for the recipient countries (approx EUR 40 million) Burkina Faso and Niger. A time where a most funds where spent through rural development projects, that also covered aspects of education (literacy, professional education) and health in local communities. Start of the transition in Dutch development cooperation from 'dutch run' 'programmes de développement integrées' towards counry-owned district budgets and budget support. 
I was responsible for a fair and up-to-date administration, internal checks and balances aimed at a legitimate spending of the development cooperation budget. Another important part of my job was to support and advise embassy staff and implementating organisations with regard to the financial management of the development cooperation activities.  
The first field trip to Kaya and Manga (Burkina Faso) to assist in the annual planning sessions and the clean up of a micro-credit facility was the start of my love for Africa.
